Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Jar
Description: Small globular jar with a slightly ovoid body. The orifice is neckless and edged with a small convex lip. A fine Nile clay was probably used with mica particles and ground shell fragments. The vessel was polished and covered with a thin brick-red slip that has since cracked. Several black patches resulted during the firing process.
